ko: 일찍 자고 일찍 일어나는 건 건강이랑 외모 둘 다에 정말 좋아.

en: Tom has had no interest in other people since he was a child.
ko: 톰은 어렸을 때부터 다른 사람들한테 관심이 없었어.

en: The washing machine is making a strange sound.
I hope my part-time job ends early today.
ko: 오늘 알바 좀 빨리 끝났으면 좋겠다.

en: Perhaps I'll make some candy today.
Shall we make candy or something today?
ko: 오늘 우리 사탕 같은 거 만들까?

en: I want to become a kinder person.
I forgot to eat lunch, so let's eat dinner early.
ko: 점심 먹는 거 깜빡했어. 저녁 일찍 먹자.

en: I don't want to meet anyone for a while and I don't want to go outside either.
ko: 당분간 아무도 만나기 싫고 나가기도 싫어.

en: Tom and Mary are playing in the park making soap bubbles.
ko: 톰이랑 메리가 공원에서 비눗방울 불면서 놀고 있어.

en: Have you ever eaten insects?
I went to the hospital.
I just got to the station. I'll be waiting for you at the library.
There's also a toilet on the fourth floor.
There is also a toilet on the fourth floor.
There is a toilet on the fourth floor, too.
Oh, I just remembered. The library's closed tomorrow.
ko: 아, 맞다. 내일 도서관 쉬는 날이야.

en: Please be careful not to forget your card or your change in the machine.
ko: 기계에 카드나 잔돈 안 두고 가게 조심해.

en: Is there anything else I can help you with?
This university was founded in 1843.
Tom wants to go by train.
I have no idea what's causing these problems.
ko: 왜 이런 문제가 생기는 건지 전혀 모르겠어.

en: We must deal with this problem right away.
ko: 이 문제 지금 당장 해결해야 돼.

en: Call me if you have a problem.
What's the problem now, Tom?
This is not our problem.
With that big salary you're getting I guess you've saved up quite a lot.
ko: 월급 그렇게 많이 받으면 돈 꽤 모았겠네.

en: Walking on a train platform while distracted is very dangerous.
ko: 딴짓하면서 기차 승강장 걷는 건 진짜 위험해.

en: Tom has two French dictionaries.
ko: 톰은 프랑스어 사전 두 권 있어.

en: Tom has three French dictionaries.
ko: 톰은 프랑스어 사전 세 권 있어.

en: "Sorry," said Tom with a tear in his eye.
We should have gone on a day that wasn't so hot.
ko: 이렇게 안 더운 날에 갔어야 됐는데.

en: We should have gone on a cooler day.
ko: 좀 더 시원한 날에 갔어야 됐는데.

en: At this restaurant, you eat spaghetti with chopsticks.
I'm 24 years old and I haven't had a boyfriend in 6 years.
I want to do something that I can't do if I'm not pressed for time.
ko: 시간에 쫓기지 않으면 할 수 없는 일을 해보고 싶어.

en: He has no ability to reason logically at all.
ko: 걔는 논리적으로 생각하는 능력이 전혀 없어.

en: If I'm reincarnated, I want to come back as a cat.
There's a large gingko tree that's said to be 800 years old inside the grounds of a nearby shrine.
ko: 근처 신사 안에 800년 됐다는 커다란 은행나무가 있어.

en: The soft afternoon sun came in through the branches of the tree and then the window.
ko: 부드러운 오후 햇살이 나뭇가지랑 창문을 지나 들어왔어.

en: Mom, Tom ate my cookie.
Tom always makes a funny face when I point the camera at him.
ko: 톰은 카메라만 들이대면 항상 웃긴 표정을 지어.

en: Tom has become incapable of loving himself.
ko: 톰은 자기 자신을 사랑할 수 없게 됐어.

en: Wait, what are you doing here?
Wait, why are you here?
Do you believe in miracles?
Tom displayed the contents of his wallet.
ko: 톰이 지갑 안에 든 걸 다 보여줬어.

en: If you feel like crying, you should cry to your heart's content.
I will go to the school tomorrow.
I open the door.
I can't stop shaking my leg.
I feel like I'm always being watched.
ko: 누가 항상 지켜보고 있는 것 같아.

en: Thanks for pointing this out.
Don't make such a mean face.
"I'm afraid of having eye surgery." "It's no time to be saying that kind of thing. At this rate, you might lose your vision completely."
ko: "눈 수술하는 거 무서워." "지금 그런 소리 할 때가 아니야. 이러다 시력을 완전히 잃을 수도 있어."

en: "I'm afraid of having eye surgery." "It's no time to be saying that kind of thing. At this rate, you might lose your eyesight."
ko: "눈 수술하는 거 무서워." "지금 그런 말 할 때가 아니야. 이러다간 정말 눈이 멀 수도 있어."

en: I'd rather live happily in the present than go down in history.
ko: 역사에 이름을 남기기보다는 그냥 지금 행복하게 살래.

en: Tom started talking to his girlfriend about breaking up.
At that time, I thought that I was going to die for real.
ko: 그때는 진짜 나 죽는 줄 알았어.

en: I hate silent movies.
Tom retired at 65.
Tom retired when he was 65.
I have become disgusted of living.
Whenever I lie down on my bed and read a book, I fall asleep.
ko: 난 침대에 누워서 책만 읽으면 잠이 오더라.

en: Tom wanted to be able to read the original Quran and solely for that reason he started learning Arabic.
ko: 톰은 코란 원문을 읽고 싶어서 오로지 그 이유만으로 아랍어를 배우기 시작했어.

en: I wonder if there's some way of attracting more Japanese speakers to Tatoeba?
ko: 타토에바에 일본어 구사자들을 더 많이 끌어들일 방법이 없을까?

en: I need those shoes.
Tom believes in traditional gender roles.
Tom believes that men should rule over women.
ko: 톰은 남자가 여자를 지배해야 한다고 생각해.

en: Tom believes in a patriarchal society.
Find this function's global maximum and global minimum.
Tom is a language genius who speaks 10 languages fluently, but he's really bad at maths and can't even solve a simple first-order equation.
ko: 톰은 10개 국어를 유창하게 하는 언어 천재인데, 수학은 진짜 못해서 간단한 일차 방정식도 못 풀어.

en: Isn't there an old bakery somewhere in this town?
ko: 이 동네 어딘가에 오래된 빵집 있지 않아?

en: Tom confessed his love to me yesterday and we have started dating.
ko: 어제 톰이 나한테 고백해서 우리 사귀기 시작했어.

en: Mary is a mother of two.
It's better if you take what Tom says with a grain of salt.
ko: 톰이 하는 말은 그냥 적당히 걸러 듣는 게 좋아.

en: Are they sleeping?
Do you have a book?
Aren't you frightened?
I think that we should take what Tom said earlier with a grain of salt.
ko: 아까 톰이 한 말은 좀 걸러서 들어야 할 것 같아.

en: Tatoeba is a project centered on Earthlings—it still only has one alien language on it.
ko: 타토에바는 지구인 중심 프로젝트라 아직 외계어는 하나밖에 없어.

en: Tom the Saturnian decided to set out for Venus over summer break to meet Mary the Venusian, who he met on Twitter.
ko: 토성인 톰은 트위터에서 만난 금성인 메리를 만나러 여름 방학 때 금성으로 떠나기로 했어.

en: Tom's voice is so sexy! It really makes my chest tight!
ko: 톰 목소리 진짜 섹시하다! 들으면 가슴이 막 떨려!

en: I've had a runny nose for two days and I've been feeling an uncomfortable sensation in my throat.
ko: 이틀 전부터 콧물 나고 목도 좀 따끔거려.

en: Tom, you're really cute so, I think you would blend in perfectly at an all-girls school.
ko: 톰, 너 진짜 귀여워서 여고에 있어도 전혀 위화감 없을 것 같아.

en: Life is made of encounters and partings.
Mary's daughter died in an accident.
Mary likes doing different things from other people.
ko: 메리는 남들이랑 다른 거 하는 걸 좋아해.

en: There's nothing more painful than losing one's loved child.
ko: 자식을 잃는 것보다 더 고통스러운 일은 없어.

en: Tom was finally able to buy himself a home, as he had long desired.
ko: 톰은 오랫동안 원했던 내 집 마련을 드디어 했어.

en: Don't complain about it. You've asked for it.
It was really fun.
The teacher made the students do a lot of homework.
ko: 선생님이 학생들한테 숙제를 엄청 많이 내주셨어.

en: That manager often makes "people" work long hours.
May I use the restroom?
Don't make me say the same thing over and over again!
ko: 똑같은 말 여러 번 하게 하지 마!

en: I'm told by everybody that I am strange.
Do you have problems in losing weight?
ko: 너 살 빼는 것 때문에 힘들어?

en: The Brothers Grimm collected fairy tales all-over Germany.
ko: 그림 형제는 독일 전역에서 동화를 수집했어.

en: The tree bore golden apples.
We went to London.
Tom, you have really taught me many things.
ko: 톰, 넌 나한테 정말 많은 걸 가르쳐줬어.

en: Tom has really taught me many things.
I have truly learned many things from Tom.
Your mental age is too low.
Are you mad at me?
Tom died because of me.
Nobody else can know.
ko: 다른 사람은 절대 알면 안 돼.

en: Tom can't write yet.
Tom can't read yet.
Tom still can't read.
The printer had a paper jam.
Tom eats a lot despite appearances.
Every detail of his writing is carefully composed.
ko: 걔 글은 문장 하나하나가 되게 세심하게 쓰였어.

en: For a business owner, having a clear overview of one's entire business is vital.
ko: 사업가라면 자기 사업 전반을 꿰뚫어 보는 게 아주 중요해.

en: Tom bought a new multifunction printer.
Tom and his friends use the school printer every month to print the student bulletin.
ko: 톰이랑 친구들은 매달 학생 회보를 뽑으려고 학교 프린터를 써.

en: When Tom translates one of my sentences, I feel glad to be alive.
ko: 톰이 내 문장을 번역해 줄 때면 살아있길 잘했다는 생각이 들어.

en: Recently, Tom hasn't been translating my sentences. Does he hate me?
ko: 요즘 톰이 내 문장을 번역 안 해주는데, 나 싫어하나?

en: There are 16 characters named Tom in this novel.
ko: 이 소설에는 톰이라는 이름의 등장인물이 16명이나 나와.

en: That's super easy.
Piece of cake!
As long as it's not too much of a bother, people like to be nice to other people.
ko: 너무 번거롭지만 않으면 사람들은 남한테 친절하게 대하고 싶어 해.

en: I'm not in the mood to watch TV this evening.
ko: 오늘 저녁엔 TV 볼 기분이 아니야.

en: I made too many cookies, so won't you take some?
ko: 쿠키를 너무 많이 만들었는데, 좀 가져갈래?

en: If I could, I would love to experience once again a bittersweet love like in middle school.
ko: 할 수만 있다면 중학교 때처럼 그런 달콤쌉싸름한 사랑을 다시 한번 해보고 싶어.

en: After her first date with Tom, Mary was distracted all day, couldn't concentrate on her classes and didn't feel hungry.
ko: 톰이랑 첫 데이트를 하고 나서 메리는 하루 종일 멍하고 수업에도 집중 못 하고 배고픈 줄도 몰랐어.

en: At last, the rain stopped.
Can you stop talking loudly on the phone at night?
ko: 밤에 전화 크게 하는 것 좀 그만해 줄래?

en: It is said that Lycopene, a pigment found in tomatoes, makes your skin beautiful and helps you lose weight.
ko: 토마토에 있는 라이코펜이라는 성분이 피부도 좋게 해주고 살 빼는 데도 도움이 된대.

en: I understand that life without love is impossible for me.
ko: 난 사랑 없는 삶은 불가능하다는 걸 깨달았어.

en: What are your favorite ingredients to put into Miso soup?
ko: 미소 된장국에 어떤 재료 넣는 걸 제일 좋아해?

en: I didn't think that university would be so much fun.
It's best to discuss relationship issues directly with your partner.
ko: 연인 사이 문제는 상대방이랑 직접 얘기하는 게 제일 좋아.

en: I am rapidly losing the ability of immersing myself in activities that I love.
ko: 내가 좋아하는 일에 몰입하는 능력이 점점 떨어지고 있어.

en: Sorry, I'm bad at explaining.
Tom's translation is too focused on the rhythm of English translation, and ignores the nuances of the original.
ko: 톰의 번역은 영어 번역의 리듬에만 너무 치중해서 원문의 뉘앙스를 무시하고 있어.

en: My normal body temperature is around 37 degrees.
I've had the flu since Monday. Right now, my temperature has gone down, but I don't feel completely normal yet.
ko: 월요일부터 독감에 걸렸어. 지금은 열이 내렸는데 아직 몸 상태가 완전히 돌아오진 않았어.

en: My only worry is that I have no worries.
ko: 내 유일한 걱정은 걱정이 없다는 거야.

en: Tom's personality changes completely when he grabs the mic.
ko: 톰은 마이크만 잡으면 성격이 완전히 변해.

en: Don't run around the classrooms.
Don't run around the house.
I've lost my wallet.
I need to go to the hospital.
Tom works in Boston.
Tom is working in Boston.
Tom was worried that Mary's words were indirectly aimed at him, but in truth she was only talking about herself in a self-depreciating manner.
ko: 톰은 메리의 말이 자기를 겨냥한 게 아닐까 걱정했지만, 사실 메리는 그냥 자조적으로 자기 얘기를 하고 있었을 뿐이었어.

en: Sorry I doubted you.
As long as the whole world has not reached happiness, individual happiness is impossible.
ko: 온 세상이 행복해지지 않는 한, 개인의 행복도 불가능해.

en: Happy people are those who remember only the good things from the past, while unhappy people are those who remember only the opposite.
ko: 행복한 사람은 과거의 좋은 기억만 떠올리는 사람이고, 불행한 사람은 그 반대만 기억하는 사람이야.

en: Please look at the pamphlet for the details.
Why didn't you bring your hat today?
Tom, there's a bee on your head!
I really had an enjoyable childhood.
ko: 나 어릴 때 정말 즐겁게 보냈어.

en: I had such fun times when I was a kid.
Mary looks cute no matter what she wears.
I'm just an amateur when it comes to art, but I really like this painting.
ko: 예술은 잘 모르는 아마추어지만, 이 그림 정말 마음에 들어.

en: You should not judge people based on their name.
ko: 이름만 보고 사람을 판단하면 안 돼.

en: Please store it at -18C or lower.
Goethe's poem "Mignon" is widely read in Japan in Mori Ogai's excellent translation.
ko: 괴테의 시 '미뇽'은 모리 오가이의 훌륭한 번역으로 일본에서 널리 읽히고 있어.

en: I think that Liszt's "Forgotten Waltz No.3" is a hidden masterpiece.
ko: 리스트의 '잊혀진 왈츠 3번'은 숨겨진 명곡인 것 같아.

en: On one hand, water shortages are expected this summer because of lower rainfall, but on the other hand, large rainstorms are 3.5 times more likely locally than last year.
ko: 한편으로는 강수량이 적어서 올여름 물 부족이 예상되는데, 다른 한편으로는 국지성 호우가 작년보다 3.5배나 더 잦을 거래.

en: If you feel a tremor near the coast, evacuate immediately to high ground or another safe location.
ko: 해안가에서 진동이 느껴지면 즉시 높은 곳이나 안전한 곳으로 대피해.

en: You shouldn't judge a person based on his or her name.
You shouldn't judge people based on their names.
ko: 이름만 보고 사람들을 판단해서는 안 돼.

en: The world sometimes seems meaningless.
ko: 세상이 가끔은 아무 의미 없게 느껴져.

en: He dug a hole using a shovel.
You could at least knock!
Knock before coming in.
My parents are travelling overseas for a week.
ko: 우리 부모님 일주일 동안 해외여행 가셔.

en: I want to eat a good yakisoba bread.
I want to eat a tasty yakisoba bread.
The sun went down behind the mountains.
Can I have your cellphone number?
ko: 핸드폰 번호 좀 알려줄 수 있어?

en: It occurred to me that there's a book that I need to return today.
ko: 오늘 반납해야 할 책이 있다는 게 갑자기 생각났어.

en: Is today Saturday?
I don't speak English.
He's sitting on the bench.
I washed my own shirts.
I washed my own shirt.
I live on this planet.
Go away. I want to be alone.
Go somewhere else. I want to be alone.
ko: 다른 데 가. 나 혼자 있고 싶어.

en: It's really hot.
What's the name of this river?
Both you and I are men.
She wanted to be a singer.
Please refrain from excessive drinking.
I know those girls over there quite well.
It'll soon be spring.
Did your trip go well?
Was it a nice trip?
Where's the proof that he committed a crime?
ko: 걔가 범죄를 저질렀다는 증거가 어디 있어?

en: One of the reasons Twitter is popular in Japan is a characteristic of Japanese itself: Japanese uses ideograms which enable it to convey more information in just 140 characters than other languages, not counting Chinese. Incidentally, the Japanese version of this sentence is written with exactly 140 characters. How many characters does it take in other languages?
ko: 일본에서 트위터가 인기 있는 이유 중 하나는 일본어 자체의 특징 때문인데, 일본어는 표의 문자를 써서 중국어를 빼면 다른 언어보다 140자 안에 더 많은 정보를 담을 수 있거든. 마침 이 문장의 일본어 버전도 딱 140자야. 다른 언어로는 몇 자나 필요할까?

en: The track club was the only place where I could be myself.
ko: 육상부는 내가 나다워질 수 있는 유일한 곳이었어.

en: "What's the capital of Sri Lanka?" "Sri Jayawardenapura Kotte." "Correct!"
Mary can't bring herself to eat chocolates in the shape of cute animals, so she asked Tom not to give her any anymore.
ko: 메리는 귀여운 동물 모양 초콜릿은 차마 못 먹겠어서, 톰한테 이제 그런 거 주지 말라고 했어.

en: Tom is known as Mary on the Internet.
He stepped on a Lego.
Tom and Mary are hugging each other naked.
Everyone knows there is no such thing as a perfect person.
ko: 완벽한 사람은 없다는 거 누구나 다 알아.

en: This month really flew by without me doing anything at all.
ko: 이번 달은 진짜 아무것도 안 했는데 벌써 한 달이 훌쩍 지나갔네.

en: Tom, with his good manners and winning smile, is popular with both men and women.
ko: 톰은 매너도 좋고 미소도 매력적이라 남녀 모두에게 인기가 많아.
